episodes.title: She Escaped Gloriavale Cult & Found Her Voice as a Woman: Lilia Tarawa | The Kotodama Podcast Ep. 21
episodes.description:
What happens when the place that raised you also abused and silenced you?

In this deeply moving episode of the Kotodama Podcast, I sat down with Lilia Tarawa — bestselling author, brand coach, and former member of the infamous Gloriavale cult.

Born into a highly controlling, cult environment, Lilia shared what it’s really like to grow up believing this world is all there is. She opened up about the emotional conflict of belonging and oppression, the cost of losing your voice, and the terrifying freedom that comes with leaving everything you’ve ever known.

Together, we explores:
- What life inside a cult really feels like - and why it can be both heaven and hell
- The hidden trauma of control, shame, and suppressed identity
- Reclaiming femininity, sexuality, and self-worth after indoctrination
- Why your story doesn’t need to be sensational to be powerful
- How storytelling can heal trauma and build authentic personal brands
- Treating your energy like a multimillion-dollar asset
- Why healing begins the moment you stop waiting for permission

This conversation is honest, and deeply empowering — whether you’ve experienced religious trauma, left a high-control environment, or are simply learning to trust your own voice again.

✨ You are the permission you’ve been looking for.
✨ Your story matters.
✨ And healing starts with the choices you make today.

Watch until the end for profound insights on boundaries, mindset, money, identity, and creating a life that actually feels good.

episodes.title: EX-CULT MEMBER SPEAKS OUT: Diane Benscoter on "The Moonies" | The Kotodama Podcast Ep. 18
episodes.description:
What really happens inside a cult, and how do intelligent, compassionate people get pulled in?

In this episode of The Kotodama Podcast, I sat down with Diane Benscoter, a former member of the Unification Church (often referred to as “The Moonies”), who joined at just 17 years old. Diane speaks candidly about the psychological manipulation, identity loss, and emotional hooks that kept her inside, and the long, difficult journey of reclaiming her voice after leaving.

I intend that this conversation helps all of us to have more compassion and understanding for people who went through something similar like Diane, and learn what we can do to avoid falling victim to the psychological manipulation tactics of cult groups.

Diane and I explored:
- Why anyone can be vulnerable to cult influence
- The subtle psychological tactics cults use (us vs. them, love bombing, charisma)
- How loneliness, purpose, and community are often exploited
- What leaving a cult does to your sense of identity
- Why empathy — not judgment — is essential when talking about cult members
- How modern technology, media, and disinformation use similar manipulation tactics today

Diane offers rare insight into how belief systems take hold, how cognitive dissonance works, and why awareness and self-reflection are more important than ever in our current world.

If you’re interested in psychology, cult dynamics, spirituality, personal growth, autonomy, or critical thinking, this episode is for you!

“One person can make a lot of change.”
